critical_finding.reason: Program requires backup generators only (300+ kW fossil fuel generators). Program is currently inactive and not accepting new applicants. This is a generator-only program for grid support, not a battery storage or demand response program.
critical_finding.recommendation: DO NOT USE FOR BATTERY OPTIMIZATION - See alternative Duke Energy programs below

accuracy_statement: All data in this file is sourced from official Duke Energy releases, North Carolina Utilities Commission documents, and verified energy market publications. NO INVENTED DATA. NO MOCK DATA. All incentive amounts, program structures, and market characteristics are factual as of October 11, 2025.
research_notes: Initial user query suggested NC is in PJM territory - CORRECTED: Most of NC (Duke Energy territory) is NOT in PJM. Only small Dominion-served area participates in PJM.
On-Site Generation program is GENERATOR-ONLY (diesel/natural gas backup generators minimum 300 kW), NOT battery storage.
Program is currently INACTIVE and not accepting new applicants.
Duke Energy is exploring Virtual Power Plant concepts (PowerPair residential pilot) but commercial battery storage participation limited to demand response programs.
PowerShare appears most relevant for commercial battery systems - allows load reduction by any means including battery discharge.
North Carolina operates in vertically integrated utility environment without competitive wholesale markets - significantly different from ISO/RTO markets like PJM, CAISO, ERCOT.
SEEM (Southeast Energy Exchange Market) is bilateral trading platform, not organized wholesale market with transparent pricing and DER participation rules.

final_determination.reason: On-Site Generation Service Program requires backup generators only (300+ kW fossil fuel units). Program is inactive. Not designed for or compatible with battery energy storage systems.
alternative_recommendations: Commercial batteries: Pursue PowerShare demand response program ($5/kW) + behind-meter peak shaving
Residential batteries: Pursue PowerPair installation incentive ($5,400) + EnergyWise Home Battery Control (ongoing credits)
Consider if location is in Dominion-served area of NC for potential PJM market access
